00359 // POINT TYPE ===============================================================//
00363 class Point {
00364 public:
00365 
00369   real x;
00370   
00374   real y;
00375 
00381   Point(real x, real y): x(x), y(y) { }
00382 
00386   Point(): x(0.0), y(0.0) { }
00387 
00392   Point(const Point& other): x(other.x), y(other.y) {}
00393   
00400   static inline real distance(const Point& p1, const Point& p2) {
00401     return sqrt((p1.x - p2.x) * (p1.x - p2.x) + (p1.y - p2.y) * (p1.y - p2.y));
00402   }
00403 
00411   static inline real cross (const Point& l1, const Point& l2, const Point& p) {
00412     return (l1.x - p.x) * (l2.y - p.y) - (l1.y - p.y) * (l2.x - p.x);
00413   }
00414 };
00415 
00419 typedef Point* PointVector;

00421 // WEIGHTED POINT TYPE (FOR WINNOW) =========================================//
00425 class WeightedPoint {
00426 public:
00427 
00431   Point point;
00432 
00436   INT_TYPE weight;
00437   
00443   WeightedPoint(Point point, INT_TYPE weight): point(point), weight(weight) { }
00444 
00448   WeightedPoint(): point(0.0, 0.0), weight(0) { }
00449 
00456   WeightedPoint(real x, real y, INT_TYPE weight): point(x, y), weight(weight) { }  
00457 
00463   inline bool operator<(const WeightedPoint& rhs) const {
00464     return (weight < rhs.weight);
00465   }
00466 
00472   inline bool operator<=(const WeightedPoint& rhs) const {
00473     return (weight <= rhs.weight);
00474   }
00475 
00476 };

00837 #ifdef OUTPUT_DATA

00839   void print_rect_matrix(T* matrix)
00840   {
00841     index_t r, c;
00842 
00843     for (r = 0; r < nr; r++) {
00844       for (c = 0; c < nc; c++) {
00845         std::cout << MATRIX_RECT(matrix, r, c) << "\t";
00846       }
00847       std::cout << "\n";
00848     }
00849     std::cout << "\n";
00850   }
